com.tranek.chivalryserverbrowser

Class SettingsTab

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • com.tranek.chivalryserverbrowser.SettingsTab
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class SettingsTab
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The settings tab where the user can change settings of the application and video settings of Chivalry Medieval Warfare.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • tfSteamCommunityUrl

        protected javax.swing.JTextField tfSteamCommunityUrl
        The URL to the user's Steam Community page. This is linked to the URL field on the friends tab. Any changes to this will be reflected there and vice versa.

        The X resolution value launch option.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Sets up the SettingsTab and its children components.

      • getUDKConfigSetting

        public java.lang.String getUDKConfigSetting(java.lang.String file,
                                   java.lang.String key)
        Gets the value for a particular game setting. It looks for the configuration file in the user's "Documents\My Games\Chivalry Medieval Warefare\UDKGame\Config" directory.
        Parameters:
        file - the configuration file where the settings are located
        key - the name of the setting
        Returns:
        the value of the setting
        See Also:
        JFileChooser.getFileSystemView(), FileSystemView.getDefaultDirectory(), BufferedReader, FileReader

      • writeUDKConfigSetting

        public boolean writeUDKConfigSetting(java.lang.String file,
                            java.lang.String key,
                            java.lang.String value)
        Writes the value for a particular game setting to the configuration file. It looks for the configuration file in the user's "Documents\My Games\Chivalry Medieval Warefare\UDKGame\Config" directory.
        Parameters:
        file - the configuration file where the settings are located
        key - the name of the setting
        value - the value of the setting
        Returns:
        true if it successfully wrote the setting to the configuration file; false otherwise
